title: In the US, there's Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, Amazon, Apple. In China, there's WeChat, Sina Weibo, Youku, Alibaba, Huawei. Where are the European equivalents? Is it time for Europe to invest in creating its own tech companies? - Quora

response.answer_text: IMO, all these proprietary services are a bad thing. We used to have something approaching ‘social media’ using open protocols and the user chose their own ‘app’ to utilise those protocols/APIs and present the user with differing UIs. Now, everything is proprietary and pretty much locked in (to one degree or another); and the result is that every user is now subject to the politics of the various countries that control the corporations. To put it mildly, it was better before. Anyway, Europe had plenty of tech companies, but they were stomped all over (read: squashed and/or bought out) by aggressive American companies, and then disappeared mostly. I might also point out that the USA, China and Europe are not equivalent entities (two nations and a geopolitical continent of sorts), and they aren’t even the only ones…what about the Indian subcontinent, and them down under, for example? Are they invisible or somehow don’t count?

I dont think there is a demand for the clone of those in EU, The reason China has demand is The China has ability to produce their own version of those apps.The China has completely different political and government system, comparing to the West, As the west claim that’s the way Chinese government to “control” the citizens “freedom” etc. however, go thought all the west media you can tell why China “control” that. no one want a neighborhood keeping make up stories to tell my kids how bad I am right?
